interface.name: surface_augmenter
interface.description: The global interface exposing surface delegated composition capabilities is used to instantiate an interface extension for a wl_surface object. This extended interface will then allow delegated compostion of the surface contents, effectively disconnecting the direct relationship between the buffer and the surface content (adding support for solid quads and rounded corner for instance).

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will not be using this protocol object anymore. This does not affect any other objects, augmenter objects included.

entry.name: augmented_surface_exists
entry.summary: the surface already has a augmenter object associated

request.name: create_solid_color_buffer
request.description: Instantiate a buffer of the given size for the purpose of a solid color quad of a given color.

arg.name: color
arg.summary: quad color represented by a SkColor4f

request.name: get_augmented_surface
request.description: Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_surface to extend composition of its content. If the given wl_surface already has a augmentation object associated, the delegate_exists protocol error is raised.

request.name: get_augmented_subsurface

description.summary: extend sub surface interface for delegation

request.description: Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_subsurface to extend composition of its content. If the given wl_subsurface already has a augmentation object associated, the delegate_exists protocol error is raised.

interface.name: augmented_surface
interface.description: An additional interface to a wl_surface object, which allows the client to specify the delegated composition of the surface contents.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: remove delegated composition of the surface

request.description: The associated wl_surface's augmenter is removed. The change is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

entry.name: bad_value
entry.summary: negative values in radius or size

request.name: set_rounded_corners
request.description: [Deprecated] Informs the server that it must apply the rounded corners mask filter that shall be applied on next commit. Use set_rounded_corners_bounds instead.

request.name: set_destination_size

description.summary: set the surface destination viewport size, with subpixel accuracy

request.description: Sets the surface destination viewport size, with subpixel accuracy. This state is double-buffered, and is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_rounded_clip_bounds

description.summary: set the surface rounded clip bounds

request.description: Informs the server that it must apply the rounded clipping mask filter that shall be applied on next commit. The mask can be uniform for several surfaces and applied uniformally so that two or more surfaces visually look as a single surface with rounded corners. Please note this is can only be used on surfaces that are used as overlays, which must not have any subtrees. The rounding will be ignored if the bounds are outside of the surface.

request.name: set_background_color

description.summary: sets a background color of this surface

request.description: Sets a background color of a this surface. This information will be associated with the next buffer commit. Please note this is different from solid color buffers, which creates a new buffer instance, and rather provides additional information how the buffer should be composited. Passing empty array means the background color is reset. The default value is determined by the Wayland compositor then.

arg.name: color
arg.summary: overlay color represented by a SkColor4f

interface.name: augmented_sub_surface
interface.description: An additional interface to a wl_subsurface object, which allows the client to specify the delegated composition of the surface contents.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: remove delegated composition of the surface

request.description: The associated wl_surface's augmenter is removed. The change is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_position

description.summary: sets a subsurface position with subpixel accuracy

request.description:
This schedules a sub-surface position change. The sub-surface will be moved so that its origin (top left corner pixel) will be at the location x, y of the parent surface coordinate system. The coordinates are not restricted to the parent surface area. Negative values are allowed.
The scheduled coordinates will take effect whenever the state of the parent surface is applied. When this happens depends on whether the parent surface is in synchronized mode or not. See wl_subsurface.set_sync and wl_subsurface.set_desync for details.
If more than one set_position request is invoked by the client before the commit of the parent surface, the position of a new request always replaces the scheduled position from any previous request.
The initial position is 0, 0. This state is double-buffered, and is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

arg.name: x
arg.summary: x coordinate in the parent surface

arg.name: y
arg.summary: y coordinate in the parent surface

request.name: set_clip_rect

description.summary: sets a subsurface clip rect with subpixel accuracy

request.description:
This schedules a clip rect to be applied when drawing this sub-surface. The clip will be placed with its origin (top left corner pixel) at the location x, y of the parent surface coordinate system. The coordinates are not restricted to the parent surface area. Negative x and y values are allowed.
If all of x, y, width and height are -1.0, the clip rect is unset instead.
Initially, surfaces have no clip set. This state is double-buffered, and is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

arg.name: x
arg.summary: x coordinate in the parent surface

arg.name: y
arg.summary: y coordinate in the parent surface

request.name: set_transform

description.summary: sets a subsurface transform as an affine matrix

request.description:
This schedules a transform to be applied when drawing this sub-surface. This transform does not apply to any child surfaces of this sub-surface.
The matrix should be passed as an array of 6 floats in column major order. An empty array can be sent to set the transform to the identity matrix.
The initial transform is identity. This state is double-buffered, and is applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

arg.name: matrix
arg.summary: size 6 affine matrix, or size 0 for identity matrix
